comment: DO NOT TAKE THIS CLASS. The tests are many and overly specific. Expect an quiz every single class day on a lecture she did not finish. the exams are 50 minutes long, 50 questions+, overly specific with 6 harshly graded 4-6 sentence essay questions. Everything must be handwritten. This is the hardest class I'm taking and I'm a pure math major. AVOID
rating_tags: Tough grader--Get ready to read--Lots of homework

comment: Horrible teacher gives so much work, and her D2L is the most confusing thing in the world. I ended up getting her because I switched in a late one, if you can get another teacher.
rating_tags: Tough grader--Get ready to read--Test heavy

comment: She's very knowledgeable about the subject. Usually weekly vocab quizzes, which aren't hard, but it's a lot of reading. Long lectures that are never finished, but they are on D2L. Very test heavy, mostly vocab and concepts. Does not like phones, but give extra credit for putting them up. I enjoyed her class, but she is not very organized
rating_tags: Lots of homework--Lecture heavy--Test heavy

comment: I will say she seems to really enjoy history, even making joes during lecture, but I dropped the class because I missed the first week and she didn't let me retake the test at all, and I felt so behind because lectures were heavy and had a quiz and a test the first week. She honestly gives a terrible teacher student relationship.
rating_tags: Get ready to read--Clear grading criteria--Lecture heavy

comment: She's a great professor who loves her job, she just gives a lot of work for a low  level class but she's funny and clearly cares a lot about what she does. She doesn't allow tech but she gives extra credit for not having your phone which helps
rating_tags: Tough grader--Get ready to read--EXTRA CREDIT

comment: I highly recommend not taking this professor. She has lectures that she does not finish on time, which makes us learn it ourselves. Studying for tests was useless because the tests did not make sense. Textbook readings are necessary, and it is a lot.
rating_tags: Get ready to read--Participation matters--Lots of homework

comment: I'm gonna be honest with you; if you have a chance to change teachers and get a different one, I would. I ended up getting her last minute and shes horrible. heavy on tests little to no homework and she gives you surprise quizzes on the reading that she didnot assign about once a week if your looking for a hard teacher to take you can't find harder
rating_tags: Tough grader--Lecture heavy--Test heavy

comment: Horrible professor that honestly doesn't grasp the idea of teaching and the purpose of things like lectures and assignments. Inconsiderate of your time while citing the importance of her own as an excuse for not responding to emails or grading a single assignment for months. The only reason to show up to lectures is for points (saving grace).
rating_tags: Tough grader--Get ready to read

comment: If you're willing to put in the work she's fine. Offers no late work or makeup work and if you turn something in it better be handwritten. NO technology. Everything is due at 5pm. I was failing at first but once I started making a million flashcards and reading the textbook 3 times a night I started passing.
rating_tags: Tough grader--Get ready to read--Lecture heavy

comment: basic summary is : 5pm due dates, harsh grading, doesn't respond to emails she doesn't think are important, lectures are too long half self-taught BCS never finishes and doesn't review stuff, and the phone thing is for extra credit but she'll call you out .i hated every part of this course professor made it difficult to want to learn.
rating_tags: Tough grader--Get ready to read--Lots of homework

comment: She is a nice professor but way too much work for a history class. I spend most of my time working on this class. There's a quiz basically every week and 2 or 3 assigments a week. Lots of textbook reading and vocab words. There are 2 tests and then 1 final. Heavy lectures and she doesn't finish them half the time. This was not an easy A at all.
rating_tags: Tough grader--Lots of homework--Lecture heavy

comment: She takes phones and assigns quizzes on random days cause there is no schedule. Its a high school class and the content is very easy. I kept missing quizzes and could not keep up because for some baffling reason the assigned work is due at 5:00pm instead on 11:59pm like every other class in existence. Very inflexible too would not allow any credi
rating_tags: Get ready to read--Beware of pop quizzes--Lecture heavy

comment: DONT TAKE THIS CLASS!You will read these reviews and think everyone is being dramatic,these are accurate. She isn't understanding, doesn't finish lectures,makes assignments due @5pm when she won't even grade the assignment.I made the wrong decision by ignoring these reviews and continuing to give her class a try, but I ended up having to withdraw.
rating_tags: Lots of homework--Beware of pop quizzes--So many papers

comment: Be prepared for her lectures to never be completed, hours of homework, multiple quizzes per week, no technology period (phones must be put in the back of the class), assignments due the next day at 5 P.M, zero late work accepted.
rating_tags: Get ready to read--Lots of homework--Lecture heavy

comment: Do not take this class with her as a professor your stress will increase by 10 fold.
rating_tags: Lots of homework--So many papers--Lecture heavy

comment: Professor Way, while a sincere and kind woman, is an incredibly harsh professor. For starters, she did not allow us to take digital notes, and would stop class if students had any form of technology out. Consistently fails to finish lectures in class, quiz and test questions are hyper-specific. Extremely Difficult Class.
rating_tags: Tough grader--Get ready to read--Lecture heavy

comment: She is a really nice professor, however there is an expectation that you do lots of work. I dropped this course because i missed a test due to a doctors appointment and she failed me on it. Her syllabus is her religion she will not sway at all on any minor detail. There was weekly quizzes // assignments.
rating_tags: Tough grader--Get ready to read--Amazing lectures

comment: She is a sweet lady who obviously has deep knowledge and appreciation on the subject. This was the class i spent 90% of my time on. Even when you take notes and read the textbook you'll always feel behind. Her tests cover the textbook, lectures, AND random assignments (especially documentaries). She rarely finishes lectures in class.
rating_tags: Tough grader--Get ready to read--Lots of homework

comment: Only redeeming quality is that she lets you turn in your phone for extra credit, but you cannot use laptop in class. She never finishes her lectures, assigns way too much reading, grades everything from the semester the day of the final, makes the exams too specific and difficult, and only grades up to a 92/100 for all classwork grades. STAY AWAY!
rating_tags: Tough grader--Get ready to read--Lots of homework

comment: Material was interesting but pretty jumbled. LOTS of reading/notes/studying and hard to balance w/ other classes. Communication with her was pretty difficult abt 75% of the time and HW (not quiz/tests) from Aug 28-Dec 11 wasnt even graded until the FINAL day so you had no idea if u were doing things right, with only abt 3 of them getting feedback.
rating_tags: Get ready to read--Lots of homework--Lecture heavy

comment: Just drop this class. It's really hard with 5 classes and a 40 hour job, she actually spams so much work for a easy class it's not worth it.
rating_tags: Tough grader--So many papers

comment: Bruh this class was hard asf. I studied for literally 4 hours each day and still failed all her tests. The only positive I have is that there is extra credit but you get it by turning in your phone.
rating_tags: Tough grader--Get ready to read--Lecture heavy

comment:
- Gives out textbook and lecture assignments that don't correlate
- Does not review textbook
- Tough grader
- A LOT of homework
- Class Notes aren't completed so if you need to go back to review, you're stumped
- Has review zooms at the most inconvenient times
- Goes over very specific specific things
- Please don't take her class.
rating_tags: Tough grader--Get ready to read--Lots of homework

comment: She's sweet but- DO NOT TAKE HER. Never finishes lectures, so you miss info that will be on exams. 10+ hrs a week studying & writing mandatory flashcards & still won't feel caught up. Impossible to finish in-class exams that are 50+ questions & 6 harshly graded essay responses. Never puts grades in & is overall a very difficult professor. STAY AWAY
rating_tags: Tough grader--Get ready to read--Test heavy

comment: DO NOT TAKE THIS PROF! I had this prof for the AMC (great books) cohort, and she made every class unbearable. She waits weeks to release grades and is a terrible/harsh grader. All of the material was reading books and participating in class discussions. She also called multiple students by the wrong name consistently. complete lack of respect.
rating_tags: Tough grader--Get ready to read--Participation matters

comment: Dr. Way is amazing. She's funny and keeps me interested.  You do have to read. And I mean, not because she assigned it, I mean because anything and everything will be on the tests. I think she genuinely cares for her students.  She has even made me think about switching to a history major.
rating_tags: Get ready to read--Participation matters--Test heavy

comment: The workload of this class is immense. Quizzes multiple times a week, assignments that take over an hour and barely count for half a point. Everything she says or mentions for even a second is fair game on any test and you NEED a textbook (online or otherwise) to pass because it's half the info she tests on. If you can take another class please do.
rating_tags: Get ready to read--Lots of homework--So many papers

comment: I recently had Professor Irene Way this fall semester & it was a terrible experience. There are weekly assignments & videos (which I completed & worked very hard on them ) for them to not really count as anything for my final grade. She has no grace, and she gives quizzes at least once a week. Her midterm and final is what really matters.
rating_tags: Beware of pop quizzes--Test heavy

comment: There are so many things I could say about this professor. But if you do not do well with test heavy courses and homework (only two tests and a ton of online assignments) DON'T take this professor. Extremely hard to work with + inflexible. Gives work like its your major and is out of touch with how amount of work given. Do NOT take this professor!!
rating_tags: Tough grader--Lots of homework--Test heavy

comment: Avoid if you can. She is nice enough but the courseload is insane and she is incredibly inflexible. There is a complete technology ban in the classroom including laptops and she makes you turn in your phone before class. Tons of quizes and homework and she expects you to watch hour long videos at home every week. Also not a MW class as advertised.
rating_tags: Lots of homework--Lecture heavy

comment: She is a very sweet professor; however, she does not give grace. If you miss a lot of classes you might as well count the day as a zero. She doesn't allow you to make up quizzes or test. My advice is to READ, literally everything she assigns and take notes. You will pass if you can keep up. Other than that, Good Luck!
rating_tags: Get ready to read--Lots of homework--Lecture heavy

comment: To the person who said we are all mad, because she makes us work for it. You are wrong. This class is terrible. I am in it currently and its awful. She gives you so much work only for you to take a 10 question quiz and receive failing grades. DO NOT TAKE HER. when I tell you I have applied myself, and that isn't even enough. Godspeed.
rating_tags: Tough grader--Get ready to read--Lots of homework

comment: I love Dr. Way. Everyone is just mad b/c she makes you work for your grade. If you pay attention to the lectures + do the key terms you'll be fine. Plus there are bonus points on the tests for every day you let your phone stay on a table, instead of being on it in class. She's the only teacher that made history interesting! Easy if you took AP!
rating_tags: Get ready to read--Amazing lectures --Lecture heavy

comment: As someone who loves history, I loved her and her class. You can tell she really enjoys teaching. There were some group projects and a couple quick writes a week but besides that, it was pretty chill for me. This is a lecture and reading-heavy class. I would avoid her if hist isn't your strongest subject.
rating_tags: Gives good feedback--Amazing lectures--Lecture heavy

comment: Literally, sooooo much work to do within a week between key terms, quizzes, quick writes etc. And also there was basically a mini quiz almost every time you walk in there. She goes pretty fast with her lectures so it was easier to watch from home for me. Also, she never responded to the emails that I sent her.
rating_tags: Lots of homework--Get ready to read

comment: she changed her attendance/ grading policy due to covid. the lectures in class are very detailed and she talks kind of fast. i found it easier to do the lectures from home with the recorded segment so I could just get it done. there is so much to do for the class though. we had key terms, notes, videos to watch. the test were so specific and hard
rating_tags: Lots of homework--Lecture heavy--Tough grader

comment: I did not find Dr Way as hard as many people on here say. I had her for the summer course ad she kept the course interesting. Literally if you DO THE WORK (although it is a lot of weekly assignments due), you WILL be okay. Most of the tests I got anywhere between a 75-85 and still managed to get a 87. DO ALL THE QUICK WRITES!!! Those will help.
rating_tags: Gives good feedback--Lots of homework--Participation matters

comment: Lots of weekly work, weekly quizzes, and 3 big exams with everything including quizzes under Lockdown Browser. She tries to make the weekly assignment fun, like one-sentence summaries or describe an event in a haiku. She has not graded most things by midterm and even had the Midterm the day after Spring Break unannounced, except on the syllabus.
rating_tags: Lots of homework--Get ready to read--Test heavy

comment: Theres something due at least 2 or 3 times a week and most of her quizzes are difficult. Her class is very time consuming especially if you're a full time student and have a job. You also can't complete the assignments that are due for the week in the order that you want and she gives out more work than she grades.
rating_tags: Lots of homework--Get ready to read--Lecture heavy

comment: Dr. Way is pretty passionate about history and I think that definitely added to the rigor of the course. It was pretty hard for a general Ed type course added with the intense lecture videos and readings. But if you actually pay attention and take notes, then youll be fine.
rating_tags: Lots of homework--Get ready to read--Tough grader

comment: SOOO much homework. the work load is insane. I had more work in this class each week then my other four classes combined. the tests and quizzes are impossible. worst class i have taken in my life. super nice professor but class is horrible.
rating_tags: Lots of homework--Get ready to read--Lecture heavy

comment: I'm almost positive she would've been better in person but DO NOT take her online. It's a ridiculous amount of work, quizzes and tests are super hard. The first C I've ever made and I actually put a lot of effort into the class. She's very smart and knows a lot about the subject but she was way too hard online.
rating_tags: Get ready to read--Lecture heavy--Tough grader

comment: Dr. Way is a great person and you can truly tell that she cares about History and I felt like I learned the most in her class this semester out of all the ones I took. However, she doesn't test on the content she teaches and the tests/weekly quizzes are virtually impossible to do well on. Gives lots of useless assignments. She did not take feedback
rating_tags: Get ready to read--Participation matters--Lecture heavy

comment: Not sure if it's bc I did her online, but she gave out too much work and boring 4/5-part lectures a week as if we don't have stacks of work from other classes to do. She's quite knowledgable, but too specific with grading. Her class was difficult to catch up with at times. Wouldn't recommend her unless you're able to manage your time very well!
rating_tags: Lots of homework--Get ready to read--Lecture heavy

comment: Straight did not have a good time.
rating_tags: Lecture heavy--Lots of homework--Get ready to read

comment: Do not take this class unless you want to be quizzed on things that she never teaches and the littlest details in the textbook that don't even pertain to the quizzes. Horrible experience and would never wish a professor like this on anyone.
rating_tags: Lots of homework--Test heavy--Tough grader

comment: Professor Way was a horrible professor during this pandemic. She shows no remorse for her students and is very insensitive. She gives loads of work every week and gives quizzes every week on the weekends. She gives mandatory writing assignments and is not lenient on the grading what so ever. Please do not take her class, she is very mean and hard.
rating_tags: Tough grader--Get ready to read--Lots of homework

comment: Makes the class way harder than it's supposed to be. She has mandatory writings on top of quizzes every week which she grades for accuracy and is not lenient. Most quizzes were only available on Sundays . Acts nice and will meet with you but expects extreme detail such as the names of witnesses to a court case on quiz/tests. DO NOT TAKE HER CLASS!!
rating_tags: Lots of homework--Get ready to read--Tough grader

comment: I took this class online and Professor Way assigned so much work for just one week. Every week there is a quiz (even on the weekends) and the tests are extremely difficult. You must read the textbook or you won't pass her class. I would not recommend taking this professor if you don't HAVE to.
rating_tags: Get ready to read--Test heavy--Lots of homework

comment: She seemed like a sweet person, but her online teaching style was not the best. Gave a lot of work as if we don't have other classes to do work for. My internet went out during a quiz and wouldn't allow me to redo it.
rating_tags: Lots of homework--Get ready to read--Participation matters

comment: Shes a really nice person but is extremely strict teaching. You cannot miss more than 5 classes the whole semester (even excused) or you will drop 5 points each absence after that. She gives weekly quizzes, with no make ups even for excused absences. Long readings, incomplete lectures. Tests are harshly graded. She does give extra credit though.
rating_tags: Skip class? You won't pass.--Beware of pop quizzes--Tough grader

comment: She is an amazing person and really sweet. she is super passionate about history, however, this is also her downfall. She grades the written portions of her test super rough. If you mention one thing in the portion you have to go into deep detail or points WILL be taken off. QUIZ HEAVY, hard test, not time to write, mandatory attendance for EX-C
rating_tags: Get ready to read--Participation matters--Skip class? You won't pass.

comment: Dr. Way is a very nice person, but as a teacher she is terrible. She is incredibly tough on the written portion of her tests and the multiple choice questions are very tricky. She does give extra credit for putting your phone away during the lecture. If you have any questions, she may or may not answer it. If she does she is very condescending.
rating_tags: Skip class? You won't pass.--Lecture heavy--Tough grader

comment: I ADORE Dr. Way. She is so freaking sweet and funny and insanely smart. Take all the notes and read all the things. None of it is that hard. Her discussions in class are engaging and she gives tons of extra credit for putting your phone away.

Mrs. Way is a great person and I enjoyed her as a person, but not a teacher. The tests were very hard and a big portion was key terms which essentially was her choice of roughly 10 vocabulary definitions from the chapters on the current test and you had to choose 5 and write a whole paragraph about each. Must read the book to do decent.
rating_tags: Get ready to read--Skip class? You won't pass.--Test heavy

comment: She gives 3 tests and they're hard. Lecture heavy and lots of pop quizzes. She talks a lot and seldom slows down to properly answer a question. She's very nice, but I don't think she realizes that we don't grasp the subject as easily as she does. She posts blank Power Point lectures online. Many extra credit opportunities
rating_tags: Get ready to read--Graded by few things--Lecture heavy

comment: She gives you three test over stuff we don't cover in class. She then does popup quizzes all the time over the stuff you just learned. She believes you can learn stuff through a textbook and some definitions. Her classes are mandatory and you get 3 absences before she drops you by one whole letter grade. Worst professor I have ever had.
rating_tags: Graded by few things--Beware of pop quizzes--Tough grader

comment: Shes a nice person and all, but her class is really tough. She goes over slides in class and if your taking notes, you fill in the blanks, but she posts them online without having them filled in. Her test are very difficult greatly because of key terms. Very unorganized class, constantly updating syllabus which keeps the students on their toes.
rating_tags: Get ready to read--Skip class? You won't pass.--Tough grader
